input_text:
Job Title: Access Control Technician or Senior Access Control Technician

Location: Charlottesville, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
The University of Virginia is accepting applications for an Access Control Technician or a Senior Access Control Technician to join the Facilities Management team. The successful candidate will fill one of these positions based on their experience, education, skills, and abilities. We are a multi-discipline team that works in Academic, student and faculty housing and medical center environments installing electronic access control devices, hardware and controls, and performing preventative and corrective maintenance to electronic and mechanical locking systems. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to the mission of the University while working in a collaborative and stimulating environment.

Facilities Management (FM) supports the University of Virginia's wide range of research, academic and patient care programs. With over 1,200 employees dedicated to excellence, Facilities Management is responsible for the day-to-day operation, repair and maintenance of UVA's buildings, infrastructure, and grounds as well as other University-owned and leased properties.

Responsibilities

Access Control Technicians:

Troubleshoot, diagnose, and repair electronic access control equipment and hardware.Perform preventative maintenance on electronic equipment and hardware.Install card readers, sensors, door hardware, and control boards for electronic access control systems.Perform maintenance, and repairs of automatic or electrically operated door opening devices and hardware.Practice and implement baseline skills in manual and electronic locking and security devices, assist in locksmithing services to ensure campus facilities are properly secured.Use access control software and mobile applications for programing, troubleshooting, status updates and generate reports from the databases.Adjust doors, and any related hardware to doors are closing and latching in a proper manner.Cut new or duplicate keys from existing keys, patterns, or codes.Assist all Maintenance zone departments in maintaining accessibility to the campus for maintenance purposes.Maintains current knowledge and skills of industry best practices.Answers service calls of various types in various buildings.Ensures that OSHA and general safety regulations are maintained.Respond to after-hours emergency calls as needed.In addition to the job duties listed above, other job duties may be assigned.

Senior Access Control Technicians

In addition to duties listed above,

Assist other departments with interconnections to security and fire safety systems.Maintain spare stock inventory and supplies.Prepare estimates.Assists the supervisor with ensuring a sufficient inventory of materials and supplies.Other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications

Access Control Technicians

High school diploma or equivalent2 years of experience with Electronic Access Control systemsValid Virginia Driver’s License

Senior Access Control Technicians

High school diploma or equivalent4 years of experience with Electronic Access Control systemsValid Virginia Driver’s License

Preferred Qualifications

Access Control Technicians

Manufacturer training/certificate electronic access control (Cboard, lenel, Salto, HID etc.)

Senior Access Control Technicians

Manufacturer training/certificate electronic access control (Cboard, lenel, Salto, HID etc.)5+ Years experience with electronic access control systemsDCJS, Electronic Security Association (ESA), Certified Electronics Technician

Compensation

Anticipated Hiring Range for Access Control Technician - $25 - $30/hr

Anticipated Hiring Range for Senior Access Control Technician - $28 - $33/hr.

Actual hiring rates commensurate with experience.

This is a full-time position with UVA benefits. Employee benefits package highlights include:

22 days of paid time off, increasing with service; 13+ paid holidays each year, in addition to paid time off; Parental and Community Service LeaveHealth plan with options to meet healthcare and financial needsRetirement through the Virginia Retirement SystemTuition and professional development benefitsEmployee wellness program featuring activities to earn up to $500/year

Physical Demands

Employee will be required to lift various weights, climb ladders and stairs in order to complete jobs. The use of both hands and a repetitive motion will be required while performing duties.

To Apply

Apply online at http://jobs.virginia.edu/us/en/job/R0059478/Access-Control-Technician-or-Senior-Access-Control-Technician. Internal applicants must apply through their UVA Workday profile. Complete the application, and upload the following Required materials:

Resume  Note: Multiple documents can be uploaded in the CV/Resume box. Applications that are incomplete or missing required documents will not receive full consideration.

This position is open until filled.

Questions regarding the application process should be directed to Marcus Rozier, Academic Recruiter hjv5vm@virginia.edu.

The University of Virginia, including the UVA Health System which represents the UVA Medical Center, Schools of Medicine and Nursing, UVA Physician’s Group and the Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, are fundamentally committed to the diversity of our faculty and staff. We believe diversity is excellence expressing itself through every person's perspectives and lived experiences. We are equal opportunity and affirmative action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, national or ethnic origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, veteran status, and family medical or genetic information.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
